result.execSummary:
The defendant GARY L MEENEN JR was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: -Court orders the fine and costs in this file shall be paid from all funds received into the defendant's prison accounts in accordance with prison policy. If any fines and/or costs remain outstanding at the end of the initial confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.  If probation/supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

-Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance. 
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment and follow-up as recommended. 
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Transcript:  May 23, 2022 Plea and Sentencing

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: **PROCESSING COMPLETE**

1:01 PM Defendant GARY L MEENEN JR in court, in custody.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Statement by the Court - goes over the defendant's speedy trial demand and the right to counsel. Court goes over right to counsel and how to obtain one. Defendant does not want an attorney and does not want a speedy trial. Statement by ADA McElroy - has met with the defendant and relayed an offer and the defendant will accept. ADA recites offer - upon plea to count 2, will dismiss the repeater and recommend prison, costs, and conditions and count 1 and 3 will be dismissed and read-in. Defendant concurs. Court instructs defendant of his/her right to counsel. Defendant waives right to counsel. Court accepts waiver. Defendant will enter a plea of NO CONTEST.

Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights. Court goes over the elements of each offense. Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty. Court instructs defendant regarding deportation. (If felony) Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions. 

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST. Court finds the plea is made knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently. Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea. Court finds the defendant guilty on count 2 dismissing the repeater and orders counts 1 & 3 be dismissed and read-in. Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today. Sentencing statement by ADA. Statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

-3 years WSP, with 1 1/2 year of Initial Confinement and 1 1/2 years of Extended Supervision, concurrent to any other sentence.

CONDITIONS:

-Court costs. 
-Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance. 
-AODA and any follow-up. 
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment and follow-up as recommended. 
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Court grants the defendant 194 days of sentence credit.

Court adjourned at 1:16 PM

NOTES: Per Judge, the defendant is eligible for the Earned release program which includes Challenge Incarceration Program & Substance Abuse Program.
Stanley Correctional Institution - 05/23/2022 at 1:00 PM (Status Hearing)
Status hearing on May 23, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

8:35 AM Defendant GARY L MEENEN JR appeared by video.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant has no objection to holding this this hearing via zoom. State has one witness.

Nathan Nelson sworn, direct by ADA McElroy is employed thru the Waupaca County Sheriff's Department as a Detective Sergeant. Was employed on the date in question. Testimony given. Venue established. Identified the defendant present in court. Cross exam by the defendant. Statement by the Court to the defendant. Defendant requests to testify on his own behalf. Defendant sworn. Testimony given. Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony has been committed and that the felony probably was committed by the defendant and binds the defendant over for trial. Corut informs the defendant that the information will be sent to him and mirrors the criminal complaint.

State files an information with the court - same as the criminal complaint. Defendant enters a plea of Not Guilty. Court will set for Status Hearing on May 23, 2022 at 1:00 PM. Statement by the defendant - requests this get this done as soon as possible and requests to appear via zoom. Court takes this request as a Speedy Trial demand. Court orders WRIT to be done.

Court adjourned at 8:50 AM

10:33 AM Defendant GARY L MEENEN JR appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Statement by defendant - if ADA will make an offer, the defednant will waive the preliminary hearing. Statement by ADA - will not make an offer at this time. Prelim will proceed tomorrow 05/17.


Court adjourned at 10:34 AM
Instructions for How to Appear Remotely (emailed to Stanley Correctional)
Preliminary hearing on May 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary Hearing - Schedule or Waiver on May 16, 2022 at 10:30 am.
DEF REFUSED TO SIGN: $500 Sig Bond + Conditions : Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.
Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.

9:32 AM Defendant GARY L MEENEN JR appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant has no objection to holding this hearing by zoom. Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count and as repeater. Court instructs defendant of his/her right to an attorney.  ADA McElroy makes bond recommendation. Court sets bond at $500 signature bond and conditions of: Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department. Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing. Defendant does not waive the time limits. Defendant requests to hear to prelim by zoom. Court will set for Prelim on May 17, 2022 at 10:30 AM. Status of Counsel/Prelim May 16, 2022 at 1:00 PM. Def requests discovery. Court informs defendant to file a motion.

Court adjourned at 9:36 AM.
Instructions for How to Appear Remotely (emailed to Stanley Correctional along with a copy of the criminal complaint for the defendant.)
